intro: Pleurothallis miniatura, commonly known as the miniature orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces tiny, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and compact size. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value.
